name: Neural Information Processing
course_description: This course covers computational and theoretical approaches to understanding neural information processing. Students will learn about neural networks, deep learning architectures, and biologically-inspired computing models. Topics include supervised and unsupervised learning, convolutional neural networks, recurrent neural networks, and generative models.
bullet_points: Understand fundamental principles of neural computation
Implement modern deep learning architectures
Explore connections between biological and artificial neural systems

name: Computer Security
course_description: This course provides an introduction to the principles and practice of computer security. Topics include cryptography, authentication, access control, software security, network security, web security, and security management. Students will gain hands-on experience with security tools and techniques through practical exercises.
bullet_points: Learn core principles of computer security
Develop skills in security analysis and implementation
Understand threats and countermeasures in modern systems

name: Software Engineering
course_description: This course introduces software engineering principles and practices for the systematic development of software systems. Topics include requirements analysis, software design, implementation, testing, and maintenance. Students will work in teams on a software project, applying agile development methods and tools.
bullet_points: Learn systematic approaches to software development
Practice teamwork and collaboration skills
Apply software engineering methods to real problems

name: Computational Physics
course_description: This course introduces computational methods for solving physical problems. Students will learn programming techniques and numerical methods for simulating physical systems, analyzing data, and visualizing results. Applications include mechanics, electromagnetism, quantum physics, and statistical physics.
bullet_points: Develop computational skills for physics applications
Implement numerical solutions to physical problems
Visualize and analyze physics simulation data

name: Geographical Information Systems
course_description: This course provides an introduction to the concepts and applications of Geographical Information Systems (GIS). Students will learn to collect, manage, analyze, and visualize spatial data. The course covers spatial data models, cartography, spatial analysis, and the use of GIS software for solving geographical problems.
bullet_points: Learn fundamental GIS concepts and techniques
Develop skills in spatial data analysis
Apply GIS to solve real-world geographical problems

name: Business Analytics
course_description: This course introduces the concepts and tools of business analytics for data-driven decision making. Students will learn methods for descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics, including data visualization, statistical analysis, and optimization techniques. The course emphasizes practical applications in business contexts.
bullet_points: Understand key concepts in business analytics
Apply analytical techniques to business problems
Develop skills in data-driven decision making

name: Data Mining and Machine Learning
course_description: This course covers the principles and techniques of data mining and machine learning for extracting knowledge from data. Topics include classification, clustering, association rules, regression, feature selection, and model evaluation. Students will gain hands-on experience with data mining tools and algorithms.
bullet_points: Learn core data mining algorithms and techniques
Implement machine learning models for prediction
Develop skills in data preparation and feature engineering
